fields.description:
How to quickly switch to view next/previous file?

For example, I have two files in my repo: {{a.jpg}} and {{b.jpg}}. Now I am opened and viewing {{a.jpg}}. How to quickly switch to view {{b.jpg}} on bitbucket website?

Or how to view all my files of current repo in {{Large Icons}}-like view so that I can preview them to make sure before jump into certain item?

fields.description:
The current Bamboo broker utilizes the [queue API|https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo/REST/5.0-SNAPSHOT/#d2e927] of Bamboo. This _forces_ a build no matter what options are set in [the repo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Git] or [branch configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using%2Bplan%2Bbranches].

There needs to be a new broker that uses the updateAndBuild.action that is outlined in the [scripts provided for post-commit hooks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Repository%2Btriggers%2Bthe%2Bbuild%2Bwhen%2Bchanges%2Bare%2Bcommitted].
fields.summary: Create Bamboo Trigger Broker (BB-9179)

fields.description:
Id like forum/Q&A functionality from my issue-tracker just like this tracker we're using now. At the moment its nearly doing everything i want but id like it to not keep tracking minor changes to the issue like correcting spelling mistakes in the text of the comment.

Better still hide those kind of minor typo updates from view since they're not  constructive in the tracking of an issue, a typo is just a typo!! This way its like a Q & A forum.

Even better still give the repo admin/owner the choice of whether to track the minor change or not. Admins could also have control over whether ordinary tracker users have the ability to show or hide minor edits to their comments

fields.description:
I've been testing Bitbucket POST hooks and found an issue when I push multiple commits from a branch.  The POST data that I'm getting back is showing "branch: null" for the first commit in the set, even though the commit was against my master branch.

(The subsequent commit entry did contain the proper "branch: master" data so it's not entirely broken).

Here's a sample of the POST data that shows the issue:

'{"repository": {"website": "https://plexxi.jira.com/wiki/display/PXAP/Plexxi+Control+Home", "fork": false, "name": "PROTO_PXAP_1", "scm": "git", "owner": "plexxi", "absolute_url": "/plexxi/proto_pxap_1/", "slug": "proto_pxap_1", "is_private": true}, "truncated": false, "commits": [{"node": "213e69924726", "files": [{"type": "modified", "file": "PlexxiControl/pom.xml"}], *"branch": null*, "utctimestamp": "2013-08-29 15:07:54+00:00", "timestamp": "2013-08-29 17:07:54", "raw_node": "213e69924726c17486b8818302dba6edac15f962", "message": "Change dependency plugin version\n", "size": -1, "branches": [], "author": "joe_plexxi", "parents": ["ccee8c389890"], "raw_author": "Joe Plexxi [sourcecode%40plexxi.com]", "revision": null}, {"node": "ed5b516d865f", "files": [{"type": "modified", "file": "PlexxiControl/pom.xml"}], *"branch": "master"*, "utctimestamp": "2013-08-29 15:14:16+00:00", "timestamp": "2013-08-29 17:14:16", "raw_node": "ed5b516d865f7454029e7cd61497a38326d6d533", "message": "updated release plugin version\n", "size": -1, "author": "joe_plexxi", "parents": ["213e69924726"], "raw_author": "Joe Plexxi [sourcecode%40plexxi.com]", "revision": null}], "canon_url": "https://bitbucket.org", "user": "joe_plexxi"}'

This also manifests itself in the email hook, the email shows "None" on one of the changesets:

{code}
#!bash

2 new commits in PROTO_PXAP_1:

https://bitbucket.org/plexxi/proto_pxap_1/commits/213e69924726/
Changeset:   213e69924726
Branch:      None
User:        joe_plexxi
Date:        2013-08-29 17:07:54
Summary:     Change dependency plugin version

Affected #:  1 file

https://bitbucket.org/plexxi/proto_pxap_1/commits/ed5b516d865f/
Changeset:   ed5b516d865f
Branch:      master
User:        joe_plexxi
Date:        2013-08-29 17:14:16
Summary:     updated release plugin version

Affected #:  1 file

Repository URL: https://bitbucket.org/plexxi/proto_pxap_1/
{code}

Please let me know if I can provide any additional info.
fields.summary: POST hook missing branch name on push with multiple commits

fields.description:
Each time i get all comments from a selected issue , they also include automated created ones, but when listed the content section is blank.

For example, say i edited an issue, once updated there will be an extra comment that says:

{code}
     (USERNAME)  edited description
{code}

Now when i list this via my api the content section is blank/null:

{code}
#!php

array (size=7)
      'content' => null
      'author_info' => .....
{code}

So when i am outputing this it does not look nice with no comment.

So is there a way to:

* only receive non automated comments.
* turn off this automated comment thingy
* or actually view them rather than return null or is this a bug :-)

At the moment i am filtering out any blank ones but that just adds more code, thanks
fields.summary: Automated issue comments show up as "content: null" in API response (BB-9487)

fields.description:
I was glad to see the new feature BB-6761 (https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5554/branch-permissions-bb-6761), but unfortunately it doesn't quite give me what I was hoping for.

In our case, we want the default behavior to be that branches can't be deleted or re-written, but to give exceptions to that rule on a per-branch or per-pattern basis.  Essentially, we want developers to be able to set up their own "working" branches that they can rebase or delete to their hearts' content, but have the default behavior be to protect branches.

Since the new configuration only gives us the option to specify branches that are "protected", we can't really do what we want without explicitly listing each "protected" branch.

Essentially, I'd like to be able to say something like:\\
"Prevent rewrites on: _, except for: dev__", or "Prevent deletes on: _, except for: tmp__", etc.

I also realize that we could probably work around this to some extent by coming up with a different naming convention for our branches, but even then I still feel like there will be cases where specifying "non-protected" branches would be useful.
fields.summary: Allow specifying which branches may be deleted, rewritten, etc. (BB-9184)

fields.description:
Try typing in some text into a textarea on bitbucket. Say this 'create issue' form (https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new) or a comment form on a commit. Type in a few lines.

a) Navigate away by clicking on a link or hitting the 'back' button. The user should be warned that they have unsaved changes.

b) Return to the page with the form. The contents typed in are missing.

Both these behaviors would work for free on any modern browser if you just used a simple textarea.

<Rant>Data loss is a huge problem when it happens. It stifles long-form conversation. It's worth being conservative to avoid.

I remember when browser textareas used to eat my comments all the time. It took 10 years, but they're rock solid now. I've literally had my laptop battery die on me mid-sentence, booted up, restarted my browser, and there's my half-written comment right there.

This was extremely hard-won knowledge, but more and more sites seem to be reinventing the wheel without realizing the regressions they're introducing. Please, stop using markitdown or whatever fancy javascript editor you're using. This is a site for hackers, and having to write markdown by hand isn't a huge hardship for us.

At the very least, provide a mode that's a simple textarea that doesn't prevent the browser from saving its contents.

</Rant>
fields.summary: Warn before allowing navigation away from a page with text in forms (BB-9183)

fields.description:
I'm a developer for the analysis code yt ( @yt_analysis ) which is a big user of BitBucket for code review and versioning. Our tool is mostly applied to astrophysical simulation data, but we're expanding to address other domains like nuclear engineering, oceanography, and so on.

We – and much more often the users of our toolkit – often version data which can be viewed with various javascript widgets we've designed. These may be map tiles, vector images that can be interpreted in different contexts, sets of data that we have designed D3.js widgets for, and so on. For instance, we may have data that is in a typed array interpretable by Javascript as WebGL vertices.

We'd very much like to be able to deploy a mechanism to view this data in an external (or internal, although I am not familiar with the security implications of that) viewer very easily. Having the ability to design "apps" that display buttons or iframes for specific\\
filetypes would be incredibly useful, and I think would make BitBucket much more attractive for development and deployment of particular classes of applications.

As it stands, we absolutely love the inline display and diffing of images, but being able to develop, deploy and select "apps" that we enable on a per-repository basis (or even per-account basis) to view specific filetypes would be amazing and really quite transformative for online collaboration around code, products, and data. Being able\\
to deploy, say, "view in Sketchfab" or "view in [custom] D3" would be revolutionary, especially if individuals were able to develop apps the way that hooks can be developed.  Being able to select "apps" the way "hooks" are selected could be pretty amazing for Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Deploy and select data/file viewers the way hooks can be deployed and selected (BB-9182)

fields.description:
Non watchers receives notifications on Issues (from updates/comments by other Team members) they are not watching.

And No - the "watch all Issues" is NOT checked.

It seems like "Watch this issue" followed by "Stop watching" does the trick,  Issue by Issue.

Team members gets very annoyed about receiving unwanted mails .... :(
fields.summary: Non watchers receives notifications on Issues they are not watching

fields.description:
A colleage had a single commit that she wanted to make a PR from, but the "Create Pull Request" button was disabled and the page said "No changes". When switching to the "Compare" tab, it finds the commit, but a little warning icon indicates that there are conflicts between her commit and the tip.

We then merged the commit locally, resolving the conflict and pushed the merge commit, at which point the "Pull Request" tab successfully detects the (now 2) commits and allows us to open a PR.

Please either provide an option to make an initial PR that can't be auto-merged (we can always update the PR later with a manual merge commit), or at the very least don't tell the user there are no changes when in fact there is a commit, but it can't merge cleanly.
fields.summary: Create pull request incorrectly says "no changes" when the real problem is conflicts (BB-9181)

I guess lots of people have the same issue with other languages and other tabulation lengths preferences.\\
It would be great to add a setting somewhere in Bitbucket to set the tabulation length preference, ideally one for each language.

fields.description: The xemacs/XEmacs repository is experiencing multiple heads.  *This is contrary to the documentation of* _hg push_, which says it will not create multiple heads unless _--force_ is used.  In at least one occurance I know that _--force_ was *not* used.  *This bug has already effectively reverted a beta release* (.hgtags is head-specific, so the release tag that would have allowed convenient access is not visible from tip).  The net result is denial of service, which is a serious problem.

Is this an intentional change, and if so, can the documentation be updated to reflect it?

fields.description:
Many people on the issues here will frequently "vote" on an issue by commenting with a mere "+1". This is problematic for a couple of reasons

# It floods the inboxes of users with superfluous comments
# A vote is never actually counted for these people
# People then complain that people are flooding their inboxes with pointless "+1" comments
# These complaints are then emailed out to everyone, repeating step 1

I think what we need is a more intuitive UI. Maybe including the Vote link near the comment box to make it more obvious to those inclined to scroll down to add their support would do the trick. Alternatively, you could catch people who are posting "+1" as their entire comment who haven't voted and ask them if they would like to vote on the issue, because "Posting +1 is not as an effective way of alerting Atlassian of their clients requests as voting is"
fields.summary: Voting UI

It's hard to review large pull requests with a lot of files. So it would be nice to mark as approved some files that you are sure that are ok. It would be nicer if these files that you already reviewed, be collapsed so you didn't have to look at them anymore, unless they have changed again.

A mark on the side of the files that I approve on the list of changed files would be nice too.
fields.summary: Ability to approve files individually in a pull request (BB-9145)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket team,

Until a couple of weeks ago the diff tool on the bitbucket website was brilliant - on both the full commit view, and the side-by-side view for an individual file's changes, I was getting highlighted in-line diffs - and the diff-ing algorithm seemed really good at spotting a minimal set of changes to show in that view.  Fantastic for code reviews etc.

Something seems to have changed a couple of weeks back and now I'm only getting line by line diffs.

In other words, if only one character changes in a line, I'm getting it showing as the old line was removed, and the new line was added - without any highlight of that single character change.

It doesn't seem to be browser-specific.

Was this a deliberate change?  I can't find an option to turn it back on - sorry if I'm missing something! :)

Cheers
fields.summary: Web-based diff-ing no longer seems to give in-line highlights of the changes

fields.description:

Git pull/clone works very, very slow or not at all.\\
Access to the bitbucket.org website is also very slow, in addition I can't log in into my account.

Here is a tracepath from machine where I encountered the problem.

{code}
#!
zakreta:~$ tracepath bitbucket.org
 1:  user-MS-7758                                          0.075ms pmtu 1500
 1:  10.23.45.1                                            1.520ms 
 1:  10.23.45.1                                            1.328ms 
 2:  10.0.0.1                                              2.985ms 
 3:  fja9.internetdsl.tpnet.pl                             3.262ms pmtu 1466
 3:  kra-bg1.idsl.tpnet.pl                                31.519ms asymm  4

fields.description: Try to upload file "упрощенный чекаут login при переходе из корзины.jpg", got error 500 "something went wrong"

fields.description: Apostrophe in Git Directory Path Results in 404 error when browsing source tree in bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: Apostrophe in Git Directory Path Results in 404 error (BB-9148)

fields.description:
Setup:

* Create a repository with two branches
* In one branch create a new folder and put a blank file inside
* Commit the changes and push

Steps:

* Go the repository in Bitbucket and click on the source view
* Choose the branch with the folder in from the dropdown
* Navigate into the folder
* Switch to the other branch
* Observe: 404 dead link page

Bitbucket seems to assume a certain path will exist in all branches.\\
It would be better that if the path does not exist in the newly selected branch that the UI returns to viewing the root of the project in the new branch rather than giving a 404.

So my issue is not that the URL results in a 404, but rather that the UI should not attempt to go to that URL when switching branch if the URL results in a 404.
fields.summary: Switching branch in source browser can result in 404 (BB-6008)

fields.description:
Since there is an individual language option for Android (I guess because Android libraries, apps etc are not Java compatible?) would it be possible to add language options for the following:

* iOS
* Windows Phone (8)
* Windows 8
* Possibly OSX ?
fields.summary: Add new language options for iOS, Windows Phone (8), Windows 8 (BB-9144)

I've been (for two weeks) intermittently experiencing extremely slow git clone/pull speeds for my BitBucket repository 'bitbucket.org/bneiluj/moonbar' and bitbucket website access.

I have included a tracepath for an instance which is actively experiencing issues retrieving a repo from bitbucket.org:

{code}

Monospace font for links (BB-9153)

fields.description: Please hook up netbeans to issue tracking.
fields.summary: Hook up netbeans to issue tracking

fields.description:
When creating a pullrequest, it defaults to submitting to your forked repository, when selecting the source repository, the preview of which commits are included in the pull request aren't updated.

Workaround: on the pull request page, the correct set of commits is displayed.
fields.summary: Changing a Pull Request source with the same branch name doesn't update the diff/commits shown (BB-9150)

fields.description:
Bitbucket creates a default wiki "Home" page with content that includes a clone command.  If the wiki is enabled first and then the repository name is changed, the command is left out of date (and is therefore incorrect).

E.g, if the repo was named {{name_of_repository}} and later renamed {{name_of_repo}}, the clone command in the wiki Home will still say:

{{$ hg clone https://bitbucket.org/user/name_of_repository/wiki}}

which will not work.
fields.summary: Clone command is not updated in default Home of wiki when repo is renamed (BB-9176)

fields.description:
When creating a pull request, I get a JSON response instead of get redirected to the pull requests page or another page it should go.

This is using Chrome 28.0.1500.95 Mac OS X 10.8.4
fields.summary: Create pull request show a JSON response (BB-9149)

fields.description:
# Open\\
[https://bitbucket.org/repo/all/commits?name=|https://bitbucket.org/repo/all/commits%3Fname%3D]
# Select any language
# Select any filter (sort by/filter)

For example, https://bitbucket.org/repo/month/commits&language=perl

# Enjoy 404 page
fields.summary: Filters on repo/all page cause 404 in some combinations (BB-9134)

fields.description:
Is [this feature|http://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/02/04/syncing-and-merging-come-to-bitbucket/] possible using the REST api?

If not please consider for a (near) future enhancement...
fields.summary: Sync Fork via REST API (BB-9129)

fields.description:
On a private repo (which does not allow public forks), click "fork" then "create a patch queue".  The checkboxes for "this is a private repo" and "disallow public forks" are disabled (and appear to be checked), but when you submit the form it fails with the message "public repos must allow public forks".

Using chrome's dev tools to remove the disabled attribute from the two check boxes allows the patch queue to be created, so the problem is in the web UI rather than the backend.
fields.summary: Error creating patch queue for private repo (BB-9128)

fields.description:
Filed on behalf of user Jeffrey Chui from a comment in the docs:

Thank you for making the tutorial!\\
Very helpful for beginners like me. (smile)

One silly problem I had was figuring out the commit button.\\
Since there are two commit buttons; one at the top and one at the middle, I couldn't push any changes until I found the second commit button in the middle and realised the one at the menu bar did not actually commit.

Perhaps it would be better to rename the commit button "Commit your changes" and maybe make it red (or a colour that's distinct and easy to see)?
fields.summary: Commit button confusing

fields.description:
Dear,\\
We have problems downloading files from:\\
https://bitbucket.org/mediapromobile/2nd-screen-for-ios/downloads\\
Bit-rate is very low, about 5 kbps.

We have this problem connecting from our corporate connection, Public IPs are: 178.249.14.128/25 and we detect first symptom on Wednesday, 16th August.\\
Otherwise, if we try to download a file from a residential ADSL it works faster, at normal speed.

We have not modified our internet connection from Wednesday.And apparently it is correct.\\
Have you implemented some changes that could cause this problem?\\
We also sent an email to support@bitbucket.org

Thanks
fields.summary: Bit rate low from corporate connection

fields.description:
Currently Android projects just get the default icon. Add an icon for Android language projects.

The icon should:

* Feature the Android robot
* Use the Android green colour (#A4C739)

Windows Phone 8 bucket:

* Feature Windows Phone 8 logo
fields.summary: Add an icon for Android and Windows Phone projects (BB-9120)

fields.description: I'd appreciate a setting where i can switch on email-notification for all created issues _and_ updates to them related to a repository.  Currently, one can only subscribe in-general to new issue creation but then has to go to the issue itself and watch it.  I am connected to many projects and for some of them i want to see all issues-creation and changes through e-mail without this repetetive step of going to the web UI.
fields.summary: Subscribing to all issue updates for a tracker (BB-9127)

fields.description: Even when a markdown file is in a repo labelled as being of 'markdown' type, the editor defaults to plain text. Could the editor default to the file type?
fields.summary: Editor defaults to plain text when editing markdown files

fields.description:
Today if I need to add tag to particular commit in our team's git repo I must pull that commit from remote repo, tag it and then push it back.

It would be nice to have an ability to tag any commit in repository via web interface.
fields.summary: Tag commit via web (BB-9122)

fields.description: Can you show progress info when adding a file to {{Downloads}} page? The reason is that sometimes I want to upload a large file but the website just give no info about how long the process will be done. It will be damn cool if you guys can add this feature.
fields.summary: Progress info when adding a file to downloads page
Mentions in pull request description breaks with certain characters (BB-9121)

fields.description: Would it be possible to create support for OAuth 2 API in PHP or many more languages
fields.summary: API PHP Support For OAuth 2

fields.description: See [BB-9117|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9117]
fields.summary: You cannot switch to OpenID login any longer. Clicking does nothing. (BB-9117)

fields.description: See [BB-9116|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9116]
fields.summary: You cannot strip changesets from some Hg repositories  (BB-9116)

fields.description:
Currently it is possible to host a simple html site on bitbucket for a given user.

I have several open source javascript projects that I would like to put up demo pages for. Can it please be possible to have simple html sites per-project?

I can use directories but that makes it impossible to keep my demo page in the same repository as my project without copy-pasting any time I make a change (as well as having to share localstorage/cookies/etc across all my demo sites).

This is a pretty big impediment for choosing bitbucket over github for hosting small and medium sized open source web components. And I _really_ like hg a lot more.
fields.summary: Allow per-project bitbucket pages

fields.description:
we opened new repository named visacal. on blat-lapidot.

when I'm trying to enter it bring me error page 500.

the code for debug is (aaaeb016c8a941cd9b4dc7ccb388d890)

why? what could be the problem?
fields.summary: 500 error on empty repos the user doesn't have admin access to

fields.description:
i'm getting 404s when trying to download tags from a /downloads page.  i'm able to download branches, but not tags.

test page/repo:

https://bitbucket.org/stephenmathieson/testything/downloads

working (branch) link: https://bitbucket.org/stephenmathieson/testything/get/master.tar.gz

not working (tag) links:

* https://bitbucket.org/stephenmathieson/testything/get/0.0.3.tar.gz
* https://bitbucket.org/stephenmathieson/testything/get/0.0.2.tar.gz
* https://bitbucket.org/stephenmathieson/testything/get/0.0.0.tar.gz

oddly enough, this _was_ working a few hours ago.
fields.summary: inconsistent 404s on downloads (tags not working)

fields.description: See [BB-9109|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9109]
fields.summary: Cannot delete a repo through the API if you don't directly own it (BB-9109)

fields.description:
We have a large number of Bamboo build plans that are triggered by commits in our SCM (currently Fisheye/SVN OnDemand, moving to BB).

It appears that I need to configure a hook for *each* plan key that I want to trigger from Bitbucket, which is a major PITA.  It would be nice if the Bamboo hook plan key field could support wildcarding the plan key so I can enable one hook for multiple Bamboo plans.

Alternatively, since we need to provide our Bamboo URL (and it is part of our OnDemand instance), maybe providing the OnDemand URL might be sufficient to just enable the trigger for all build plans on that instance rather than having to specify a plan key at all?  (Though maybe that isn't possible to implement, but it would definitely be nice!)
fields.summary: Support multiple plan keys in Bamboo hooks (BB-9123)
Wiki links in preview are opened in edit mode (BB-9126)

fields.description:
We are receiving the following error, at random:

{code:text}
stderr: Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '131.103.20.167' to the list of known hosts.
error: git upload-pack: git-pack-objects died with error.
fatal: git upload-pack: aborting due to possible repository corruption on the remote side.
remote: error: Could not read a54b71284cbe23d49f514173cdba20c6f6f783f8        
remote: fatal: revision walk setup failed        
remote: aborting due to possible repository corruption on the remote side.
fatal: protocol error: bad pack header
{code}

Private repository in question: underwriteme/the-shed

Please help.
fields.summary: Random git-pack object errors when fetching from bitbucket (remote).
